item.title: Learning Russian with News
item.description: Series Yaroslava Russian has quite a range. From Prigozhin’s Plane Crash (2023, 29 m) to a Documented Alien (2024, 27 m). Collected in a playlist , including. 7 years in jail for anti-war price tag protest (2023, 23 m) New Argentinian president deports all Russians from Argentina (2023, 23 m) Russian President resigns in New Year’s night (2024, 55 m) Russia might have a new candidate for president (2024, 36 m) The biggest meteor in 100 years Explodes in Chelyabinsk, Russia (2024, 30 m) Victory Day | Germany’s Surrender in WWII (2024, 33 m) Learn Russian with News | Why books in Russia are being censored (2024, 24 m) Article on realnoevremya.

item.title: Learn Russian with Interviews
item.description: Viktor Tsoi The series of interviews by Boost Your Russian is modest in scope but features great names, with bilingual subtitles. For instance, Viktor Tsoi (or Цой ), shortly after a viewing of the film Игла (The Needle, 1988). Watch it on YouTube , starring Shocking Blue .

item.title: Learn Russian with Short Stories (2): Max Reads Grin
item.description: Read! Зелёная лампа tells the story of a beggar who, in exchange for money, must keep a lamp burning for several hours each day and stay by it. What seems like a cruel prank or humiliation turns out to present opportunities.

item.title: How Difficult Is Russian?
item.description: The hardest language to learn is probably one you don’t feel much for, while the easiest is the one that attracts you. But those are clichés, and still don’t answer the question. So, how hard is Russian? Not difficult at all Russian isn’t Chinese.

item.title: Learn Russian with Films (1)
item.description: Short Films with Subtitles Short films require little time or effort. The R1 playlist Short Movies collects (and continues to add) short films with subtitles. Almost everything is under half an hour; the shortest, Мужика хочу , is just 1 minute and 20 seconds, while Не повезло / Bad Luck is a rare 47-minute exception.

item.title: Is Grammar Unnecessary?
item.description: Vocabulary first Being a vlogger, Bankrupt (or Rich) exaggerates a bit, of course. Still, he manages to get by in all Russian-speaking countries. And when there are language problems: ‘Every single time I’ve been misunderstood, has been because either I didn’t know the Russian word, or I didn’t understand the Russian word that they were using.

item.title: Learning Russian during the pandemic
item.description: Resources and opportunities YouTube teachers (m/f) also stayed at home and made the best of it by continuing to create. Vlogs, lessons, webinars, and video compilations from home students: there was no shortage of material or opportunities. Also useful and entertaining outside of pandemic times.

item.title: Learn Russian with Vladimir Putin (2/2)
item.description: With a questioner who might also work for a school newspaper and a rather admiring boyish look . Anna introduces it with: “an interview with a person about whom everyone seems to have an opinion, positive or negative.” And concludes with: “and we will refrain from any political comments.

item.title: Learn Russian with Vladimir Putin (1/2)
item.description: From jokes to weapons Several options are available, both in terms of channels and topics. As part of the Russian Listening Test ( Playlist ), Anastasia Semina (Russian with Anastasia) created Putin talks about his hobbies. Путин говорит о своих хобби (2017, 2 m) and Vladimir Putin makes jokes at the press conference (2016, 3 m).

item.title: Learn Russian with Short Stories (1): Anastasia Reads Tolstoy
item.description: In part 1 Косточка (The Plum Stone), and in part 2 Старый дед и внучек (The Old Man and His Little Grandson). Text (both short) available on rvb.ru, respectively here and here . More Tolstoy Лев Толстой ( Leo Tolstoy ) also in part 10, Филипок (Filipok, 2019, 4 m), but this time from the kitchen.

item.title: How Long It Takes to Learn Russian
item.description: 1100 hours? 1100 hours, says Denis Fedorov, who refers to science. Languages in 5 categories of difficulty. 1100 hours to master Russian, which falls into category 4. That’s about 1 year of studying 3 hours a day or 3 years at 1 hour a day.

item.title: Learn Russian with Song Lyrics (1)
item.description: Звезда A great first option is Звезда (Star). With a page of explanation and translation (Explore Russian). The song (2013) is by Глюк’oZa or Glukoza ( website , Wikipedia ). From the same channel are Вечная молодость (Eternal Youth), also with explanation and translation , and an analysis of Синие сугробы (Blue Snowdrifts).
